reviews.review: No master piece but extremely good for it is made for entertainment.

The phrase "too cute by half" came to my mind frequently as I sat through this long-ish exercise. Maybe it's just me, but the director's sprinkling of a string of "MacGuffins" ("...an object, event, or character in a film or story that serves to ....keep the plot in motion despite usually lacking intrinsic importance.")  These were displayed in caregiver Marta's 4 nations of origin - tossed into the stew and serving no dramatic purpose. As audience members we were  engaged in a hard slog to unravel the old lion's death/suicide and didn't need these "Look at me, ma!" fripperies strewn in our paths as we tried to fathom Plummer's merry and extremely complicated demise. Finally, one gathers actor Smith was given to assay a New Orleans dialect although I'll be darned if these mush-mouthed attempts were ever made clear.  All these nettles kept the film at bay from my enjoyment. Finally, you simply can not place Ms. Curtis in any film without her becoming a black hole into which every scene and/or character is sucked and disappears. For trenchant movie reviews I go, more and more often, to The National Review: The phrase "too cute by half" came to my mind frequently as I sat through this long-ish exercise. Maybe it's just me, but the director's sprinkling of a string of "MacGuffins" ("...an object, event, or character in a film or story that serves to ....keep the plot in motion despite usually lacking intrinsic importance.")  These were displayed in caregiver Marta's 4 nations of origin - tossed into the stew and serving no dramatic purpose. As audience members we were  engaged in a hard slog to unravel the old lion's death/suicide and didn't need these "Look at me, ma!" fripperies strewn in our paths as we tried to fathom Plummer's merry and extremely complicated suicide/murder (?)
My husband and I loved Knives Out! Even more than a murder mystery, which it certainly was, it was a hilarious romp through some amazingly obnoxious characters. Excellent!
Probably the best of Rian Johnson, also knowing how to create the atmosphere of mystery.
It was nice to see something different in the theater. It was just okay. Quite a twist in the plot.
Knew who did it? Easy to uncover. However, lots of fun.
Great new Who-done-it movie which was fresh and engaging!  Great cast put up threat performances!
Great cast, funny who done it. Quite entertaining.

Liked--Lots of red herrings to distract from the facts, kept me guessing "who done it".  
Disliked--Daniel Craig's accent--just not the right attitude/style of a true Southern gentleman.
